title: Entropy as a Metaphor for Social Participation: Reclaiming the Beauty of Words and Meaning
description:
Jeremy, newly baptized into the Eastern Orthodox Church along with his family,  discusses the metaphor of entropy at the social level. 
Predictability has its good sides and its bad sides, as does unpredictability.
Participation is necessary for healing.
The way to transcend your suffering is to sacrifice it to a higher identity.

The depth of meaning in words like authority and obedience, Identity and communion, inclusion and exclusion, attention and rationality.

Take responsibility - heal - repent - participate. 

Previous conversations with Jeremy:
His story: https://youtu.be/0rX19eXPSRc
On the Two Great Commandments:  https://youtu.be/6IfWU3zQRjI
On fatherhood:  https://youtu.be/1zAcaxJhG9o
